title: PHV Driver’s Licence - Safety and Compliance

questions.question: What must a PHV driver check before starting their vehicle?
questions.answer: Fuel level, brakes, and lights

questions.question: What is the legal blood alcohol limit for PHV drivers?
questions.answer: 0.0% BAC while driving

questions.question: Which of the following must be displayed in a PHV vehicle?
options: A copy of the PHV insurance policy
questions.answer: The driver’s licence disc

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if a passenger becomes aggressive?
options: Politely ask them to calm down and, if necessary, report it
Drop them off immediately, even if unsafe
questions.answer: Politely ask them to calm down and, if necessary, report it

questions.question: When is a PHV driver required to report a medical condition to TfL?
options: If the condition affects their ability to drive
questions.answer: If the condition affects their ability to drive

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT required when picking up a passenger?
questions.answer: Requesting the passenger’s home address

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if they suspect human trafficking?
options: Call the police or report it to authorities
questions.answer: Call the police or report it to authorities

questions.question: Which of these is a legal requirement for PHV drivers?
options: Keeping the vehicle clean and roadworthy
questions.answer: Keeping the vehicle clean and roadworthy

questions.question: Which type of insurance must PHV drivers have?
questions.answer: Hire or reward insurance

questions.question: Which of the following is considered discriminatory under the Equality Act 2010?
options: Refusing a passenger based on their disability
Helping a passenger with a guide dog
Providing service to all passengers equally
questions.answer: Refusing a passenger based on their disability

questions.question: When must a PHV driver check their vehicle for lost property?
options: Only at the end of their shift
questions.answer: After every journey

questions.question: What must a PHV driver do if they receive a police request while on duty?
options: Ignore it if they have a passenger
questions.answer: Comply with the request immediately

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of poor customer service?
options: Refusing to assist a passenger with luggage
questions.answer: Refusing to assist a passenger with luggage

questions.question: What is a PHV driver’s responsibility regarding seat belts?
options: Ensuring all passengers wear seat belts
Only wearing a seat belt themselves
Letting passengers decide whether to wear a seat belt
Providing seat belts only to front-seat passengers
questions.answer: Ensuring all passengers wear seat belts

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if their vehicle breaks down mid-journey?
options: Ask the passenger to leave immediately
Ensure passenger safety and arrange an alternative vehicle
Ignore the issue and call for help later
questions.answer: Ensure passenger safety and arrange an alternative vehicle

questions.question: Which of the following is required when accepting a booking?
options: Ensuring the passenger has the correct change
Confirming the booking through an operator
Asking the passenger for personal details
questions.answer: Confirming the booking through an operator

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if a passenger forgets an item in their vehicle?
options: Keep it until the passenger calls
Return it to the operator or local police
questions.answer: Return it to the operator or local police

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT allowed when operating a PHV?
questions.answer: Taking direct street hires

questions.question: What should a PHV driver do if they feel tired while driving?
questions.answer: Take a break and rest

questions.question: What must a PHV driver do if their licence is suspended?
options: Continue working until notified by TfL
questions.answer: Stop working immediately

questions.question: What can you expect when someone has taken drugs or alcohol?
options: It can affect their ability to think or communicate clearly and their behavior can be difficult to predict. In cases, they may become aggressive.
questions.answer: It can affect their ability to think or communicate clearly and their behavior can be difficult to predict. In cases, they may become aggressive.

questions.question: When you are recording an incident you should try and include the following details (Select 2 correct answers)
options: Information about the attacker (name, address if known, description of clothing, age, gender)
answer: Information about the attacker (name, address if known, description of clothing, age, gender)

questions.question: What information has the section on Staying Safe covered?
options: How to keep yourself safe - keeping passengers safe is not your responsibility
How to keep both you and your passengers safe
How to avoid damaging your PHV
questions.answer: How to keep both you and your passengers safe

questions.question: Do you need to display signs about CCTV in operation?
options: Yes, signage must be displayed but not in a visible place
Yes, signage must be displayed somewhere that is easy for passengers to see
questions.answer: Yes, signage must be displayed somewhere that is easy for passengers to see

questions.question: You should never make comments or jokes about someone's (Select 2 correct answers)
options: Disability, sexual orientation or gender identity
answer: Disability, sexual orientation or gender identity

questions.question:
Installing CCTV cameras into a vehicle can reduce threats and violence against drivers. Signs in the vehicle informing passengers that CCTV is used may also help to prevent aggressive or violent behaviour. You can buy a camera or rent one. Although this is an extra cost, having a CCTV camera may reduce insurance premiums. This is because a video recording can be useful evidence when there is a dispute with a passenger.

Which one of the following statements is correct?
options: Signs in the vehicle informing passengers that CCTV is used may also help to prevent aggressive or violent behaviour
Having a CCTV camera in your vehicle will not reduce insurance premiums.
A video recording is not useful evidence when there is a dispute with a passenger
questions.answer: Signs in the vehicle informing passengers that CCTV is used may also help to prevent aggressive or violent behaviour

questions.question: Sexual behaviour between you and a passenger is?
options: Only acceptable if you both agree to it
Only acceptable if you both agree to it and it takes place after completion of the journey
Not acceptable even if you both agree to it
questions.answer: Not acceptable even if you both agree to it

questions.question: What information has the section about Driver Behaviour covered?
options: How TfL expects drivers to behave towards passengers and other road users
How TfL expects drivers to behave during Topographical assessments
How TfL expects operators to manage the drivers who work for them
questions.answer: How TfL expects drivers to behave towards passengers and other road users

questions.question: You should never? (Select 2 correct answers)
options: Look at or speak to a passenger in a way that makes them feel uncomfortable, for example staring at any part of their body
Make any political or football-related comments
Make any sexual remarks or comments about a passenger’s appearance or clothing
answer: Look at or speak to a passenger in a way that makes them feel uncomfortable, for example staring at any part of their body
Make any sexual remarks or comments about a passenger’s appearance or clothing

questions.question: You as a PHV driver have the responsibility to?
options: Make sure that your air-conditioning is ON
Make sure your passengers feel safe when they travel in your vehicle
Know all routes in central London
questions.answer: Make sure your passengers feel safe when they travel in your vehicle

questions.question:
You should never accept any bad behaviour towards you for any reason. Any offensive or violent behaviour towards you because of your race, faith, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity is a hate crime. If you experience or witness this type of behaviour TfL urges you to report it to the police so that it can be fully investigated and action taken against the offender.

Which one of the following statements is correct?
options: Angry or violent behaviour from passengers is acceptable
Any offensive or violent behaviour towards you because of your race, faith, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity is a hate crime
You should always be prepared to accept bad behaviour towards you for any reason.
questions.answer: Any offensive or violent behaviour towards you because of your race, faith, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity is a hate crime

questions.question: What information has the section on Staying Safe covered?
options: How to keep yourself safe - keeping passengers safe is not your responsibility.
How to keep both you and your passengers safe.
How to avoid damaging your PHV
questions.answer: How to keep both you and your passengers safe.

questions.question: Children are ______ able to protect themselves and are dependent on adults. This makes them vulnerable to being exploited or abused.
questions.answer: Less

questions.question: You do not need to give your details and can report incidents or concerns anonymously, but the more information you can give, the ______.
questions.answer: Better

questions.question: County lines - children and young adults are often forced to travel across countries using which method?
questions.answer: Private hire vehicles

questions.question: If you do not feel it is appropriate to report an incident to the police, which other service can you contact?
questions.answer: Crimestoppers

questions.question: You should know what to do if you have concerns that a person is at risk. What should you do?
options: Take matters into your own hands
questions.answer: Report it to the police

questions.question: Once you are licensed, what should you do to maintain communication with regulatory authorities?
options: Keep in contact and respond to communications
questions.answer: Keep in contact and respond to communications

questions.question: PHV drivers are encouraged to carry which document at all times?
questions.answer: Insurance policy

questions.question: The registered keeper of a licensed PHV receives a ______ detailing licensing conditions.
questions.answer: Leaflet

questions.question: License discs must not be ______.
questions.answer: Removed

questions.question: Once a PHV has been licensed, where should the license discs be attached?
questions.answer: Front and rear windscreens

questions.question: You must wear your badge whenever you are working as a PHV driver, including when you are waiting to receive a booking or travelling to pick up a passenger. When you wear it, you must make sure that it can clearly be seen by other people. This applies to all PHV drivers unless we have given you special permission not to. This is called an exemption. If we give you an exemption, we will send you an exemption notice. You must carry that notice with you at all times when working as a PHV driver. Which one of the following statements is correct?
options: There are no exceptions for working without a badge
If we give you an exemption, we will send you an exemption notice.
You must not carry the exemption notice with you at all times when working as a PHV driver
questions.answer: If we give you an exemption, we will send you an exemption notice.

questions.question: All children are vulnerable to harm and abuse because of?
questions.answer: Their age

questions.question: It is important that TfL has your correct home address and email address so that you can be contacted with any information about your licence. If you change your home address, you should tell TfL within 21 days. You should also tell us about any change to your email address or telephone number. This is important so TfL can keep you informed of any changes to the regulations to do with how PHVs and PHV drivers are licensed, as well as news and events that could affect your job. Which one of the following statements is correct?
options: It's not important to inform TfL if you change your address
If you change your home address, you should tell TfL within 21 days
DVLA will inform TfL of your new address
questions.answer: If you change your home address, you should tell TfL within 21 days

questions.question: Are PHV drivers allowed to stop on Zig-Zag lines?
options: Yes PHVs are allowed to stop on zig-zag lines
No, PHV drivers must not stop on zig-zag lines
questions.answer: No, PHV drivers must not stop on zig-zag lines

questions.question: Some of the words in the SERU handbook have links to the glossary section where you can find the meanings of those words. It is important that you read these meanings and understand what the words mean, but you will not be tested on their meanings. Which one of the following statements is correct?
options: You will undertake a test based on the glossary.
It is important that you read the glossary section in the SERU handbook and understand the meanings of the words but you will not be tested on their meanings.
You won't be assessed on the terms in the glossary section of the SERU handbook, therefore reading and understanding it isn't necessary.
questions.answer: It is important that you read the glossary section in the SERU handbook and understand the meanings of the words but you will not be tested on their meanings.

questions.question: Is there an upper age limit to apply for a PHV Driver's license?
questions.answer: No

questions.question: If your application is approved, TfL will send you a London PHV driver’s licence. Your licence may have some conditions attached to it. For example, if you have a medical condition, you may be required to have extra medical checks. Any conditions added to your licence will be explained in the letter sent to you with your licence. It is very important that you keep the letter and comply with any conditions that come with your licence. If you do not, then your licence may be revoked. Which one of the following statements is correct?
options: Your licence may have some conditions attached to it
Your licence may have medical and DVLA conditions attached
Your licence may have some DVLA conditions attached
questions.answer: Your licence may have some conditions attached to it

questions.question: If your PHV is designated as wheelchair accessible you will?
options: Not have to pay the congestion charge
Have to pay the congestion charge like any other PHV
Not have to pay the Congestion Charge if you are entering the zone to carry out a booking from a London licensed PHV operator
questions.answer: Not have to pay the Congestion Charge if you are entering the zone to carry out a booking from a London licensed PHV operator
